content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Sure, here is the function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    col = lowercase(col) # convert to lower case
    col = strip(col)     # strip leading/trailing whitespaces
    col = replace(col, " " => "_") # replace spaces with underscores
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_") # replace hyphens with underscores
end
```
This function takes a `String` as input and returns a cleaned column name. The `lowercase()`, `strip()`, and `replace()` functions are Julia's string manipulation functions that you can use in this context. 

Here is how you might use it:
```julia
col = " My-Column "
println(clean_column(col)) # prints "my_column"
```
In this example, the column name "My-Column" becomes "my_column". It's important to note that this function assumes that the input will be a string. If it is not (i.e., if you try to pass something other than a `String`), you may encounter an error.
